title: Fix CI failures present on 1 Nov 2025
description:
Multiple CI test failures are preventing the build from passing. These failures are unrelated to recent code changes and appear to be pre-existing issues that need to be resolved.

Context:
- All failures observed in GitHub Actions runs on 2025-11-01
- Failures span multiple platforms: Windows, macOS, and Arch Linux
- The Nix-based tests are passing successfully

Impact:
- CI pipeline is failing on every push
- Blocks confident merging of PRs
- Prevents automated quality checks from completing
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All CI jobs pass on main branch
- [ ] PowerShell linting completes without errors
- [ ] PowerShell formatting tests pass on all platforms
- [ ] No test failures in GitHub Actions workflow

title: Fix PowerShell linting errors (PSScriptAnalyzer)
description:
The PowerShell linting job is failing with 'make lint' Error 1 on Windows runners.

Observed in:
- Run 18995053910 (commit 907280d)
- Run 18996459153 (latest)

Error:
```
make: *** [Makefile:30: lint] Error 1
##[error]Process completed with exit code 2.
```

This is blocking the entire CI pipeline on Windows. The linting step must pass before tests can run.

Investigation needed:
1. Determine which PowerShell file(s) are failing linting
2. Identify the specific PSScriptAnalyzer rule violations
3. Fix the violations or update linting rules if appropriate
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] PowerShell linting completes without errors on Windows runners
- [ ] 'make lint' exits with code 0
- [ ] All PSScriptAnalyzer warnings are resolved or suppressed appropriately

title: Fix PowerShell CRLF line ending format tests
description:
Multiple ShellSpec tests are failing related to CRLF line ending handling for PowerShell files on macOS and Arch Linux.

Failing tests:
1. `spec/format_line_endings_spec.sh:94` - converts PowerShell files with LF to CRLF
2. `spec/format_line_endings_spec.sh:113` - maintains CRLF line endings in PowerShell files
3. `spec/format_line_endings_spec.sh:132` - normalizes mixed line endings in PowerShell files to CRLF

Root cause:
The format-files.sh script is not properly converting or preserving CRLF (Windows-style) line endings for PowerShell files when running on Unix-based systems (macOS, Linux).

Impact:
- 6 test failures across macOS and Arch Linux runners
- Exit code 101 on both platforms
- These tests were confirmed pre-existing (failing since at least Oct 23)

This is lower priority than the linting errors but still needs to be fixed for CI to pass.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All line ending tests pass on macOS runner
- [ ] All line ending tests pass on Arch Linux runner
- [ ] PowerShell files maintain CRLF line endings after formatting
- [ ] Mixed line endings are properly normalized to CRLF

title: Fix PowerShell trailing whitespace/newline format tests
description:
ShellSpec tests are failing related to trailing whitespace and newline handling for PowerShell files on macOS and Arch Linux.

Failing tests:
1. `spec/format_whitespace_spec.sh:63` - adds trailing CRLF to PowerShell file that lacks one
2. `spec/format_whitespace_spec.sh:82` - reduces multiple blank lines at end to single CRLF for PowerShell
3. `spec/format_whitespace_spec.sh:135` - removes trailing spaces from PowerShell files while preserving CRLF

Root cause:
The format-files.sh script's trailing whitespace and newline normalization logic is not working correctly for PowerShell files on Unix systems, particularly when it needs to preserve or add CRLF line endings.

Impact:
- 6 test failures across macOS and Arch Linux runners
- May be related to the CRLF line ending issues (LV-c699.2)
- Could potentially be fixed together with line ending issues

Note: This bead may have dependency on LV-c699.2 if the root cause is shared.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Trailing CRLF tests pass on macOS runner
- [ ] Trailing CRLF tests pass on Arch Linux runner  
- [ ] Trailing whitespace is removed while preserving CRLF
- [ ] Multiple blank lines are normalized to single CRLF

title: Fix Arch Linux CI container missing 'make' package
description:
The Arch Linux CI container is failing with 'make: command not found' error.

Observed in CI run 19003311597:
- Platform: Arch Linux (archlinux:latest container on ubuntu-latest runner)
- Step: Check formatting and lint
- Error: /__w/_temp/d10dc99c-fa54-4418-ba05-e8b059bf591f.sh: line 15: make: command not found
- Exit code: 127

Root cause:
The Arch Linux container doesn't have 'make' installed by default. This became visible after recent CI changes that started using 'make lint' command.

Impact:
- Blocks all Arch Linux CI tests
- Prevents linting and testing from running
- Only platform currently failing in CI

Investigation needed:
1. Check .github/workflows CI configuration for Arch Linux container setup
2. Determine where system dependencies are installed
3. Add 'make' to the package list for Arch container
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Arch Linux CI container has 'make' installed
- [ ] 'make lint' runs successfully in Arch container
- [ ] All Arch Linux CI tests pass
- [ ] No exit code 127 errors
